meanings.definition: To incorrectly match or connect parts or components.
meanings.sent1: She kept mispatching the puzzle pieces together.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic mispatched the wires, causing the machine to malfunction.
meanings.sent3: The robot kept mispatching its circuits, creating a funny dance routine.
meanings.sent4: Her attempt to fix the clock ended up mispatching time itself.
meanings.sent5: The tailor's mistake in mispatching the fabrics resulted in a colorful mess.

meanings.definition: The act of making a mistake in matching or connecting parts or components.
meanings.sent1: The mispatching of the cables led to a power outage.
meanings.sent2: He was frustrated by the mispatching of the documents.
meanings.sent3: The mispatching of the Lego pieces made the tower look like a modern art sculpture.
meanings.sent4: The mispatching of ideas in the meeting caused confusion among the team.
meanings.sent5: The mispatching of colors in the painting gave it a unique, abstract look.
